page.title: 04LANCASTER PARK, NEWGATE ST.
page.content: Built 1970-80 on Matheson's Gardens, {LANCASTER PARK}consists mainly of detached houses.Many of the original trees and hedges have been preserved and there are many open spaces but no other amenities except the First School.From the estate a footpath leads through Davis Wood along Scots' Ghyll to the{Wansbeck}and{Mitford Rd.} The road joins Pottery Bank and passes through{Bullers Green}to{Newgate St.,} first recorded in 1361.Here 18th and 19th century houses,many now converted to shops, and old coaching inns blend happily with a new award-winning housing scheme.From the street open many delightful courts, closes and yards; an archway leads to the{ {Bakehouse Steps,}the last of seven sets of stepping stones across the Wansbeck.Access to{Back Riggs}shops is via{Manchester St.}and{Copper Chare.}
